snippet: Even as Paulson & Company bled money last year, with returns in one funds sinking more than 50 percent, turnover was relatively rare at the $23 billion firm. But now, the analyst in charge of the firm's banking bets is departing to start his own...
abstract: Even as Paulson & Company bled money last year, with returns in one funds sinking more than 50 percent, turnover was relatively rare at the $23 billion firm. But now, the analyst in charge of the firm's banking bets is departing to start his own hedge fund, leaving a mixed record in his wake.

headline.main: Paulson Banking Analyst to Start Fund
